name: chasmanthium latifolium
description:
Also called Uniola latifolia or Northern Sea Oats, River Oats is a very ornamental grass that is easily identifiable from its drooping inflorescences and compressed spikelets. The pale green spikelets turn golden-brown by fall. 
Customer praise for River Oats: "I have this in front of my yard by the sidewalk. Good in really dry years too. Prodigious self-sower."  -Michael J., Staten Island, NY  "I love this plant!  Does great on slopes where the firm root mass helps hold the soil in place."  -Susan O., Iowa City  "My suburban Chicago 150'x10' boulevard/verge/berm area is planted with this. The self-sowing/spreading characteristic comes in handy for replacing areas damaged by road and sidewalk plows.  I can't imagine a better use for this grass or a better no-maintenance plant for this type of semi-public area. It is a sight to behold in a light fall breeze."  -Nathanial P., Wilmette, IL
